sentences.english: I gave her the silk nightgown.
sentences.chinese: 我把丝绸睡衣送给了她。

sentences.chinese: 他屏住呼吸,伸出一只手,顺着床往下摸到了他的睡衣。

sentences.english: Watson was reading the paper about some young woman in Kensington who was run over. Had no business in the street at that hour. I believe she was in her nightgown.
sentences.chinese: 我拿到电报的时候华生正在读一篇关于肯辛顿某个年轻女人被车撞死的新闻，时间是晚上，街道上没什么人，我想当时那悲惨的女人还穿着她的睡衣呢。

detailed_translations.english: a nightdress

name: salmon
trans: 鲑鱼；大马哈鱼；鲑肉色；鲑鱼肉；橙红色，粉橙色

sentences.chinese: 整条大麻哈鱼被端上了桌，并用欧芹、西红柿片和黄瓜片作为花色配菜。

sentences.english: State authorities have ordered cutbacks in deliveries of water from the delta because of the threat to endangered species of salmon and smelt.
sentences.chinese: 由于鲑鱼和胡瓜鱼这些濒危物种受到威胁，国家当局已经要求消减从该三角洲往外输水的量。

detailed_translations.english: a large fish with silver skin and pink flesh that lives in the sea but swims up rivers to lay its eggs

name: ordeal
trans: 折磨；严酷的考验；痛苦的经验

sentences.english: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.english: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.english: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.chinese: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

sentences.chinese: 每一章末尾都有注释。

sentences.english: The alley led to the railway bridge.
sentences.chinese: 这条小巷通往铁路桥。

sentences.english: She found the side alley where the stage door was located.
sentences.chinese: 她找到了剧场后门所在的小巷。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow street between or behind buildings, not usually used by cars

sentences.english: schoolboy slang
sentences.chinese: 学生俚语

detailed_translations.english: very informal, sometimes offensive language that is used especially by people who belong to a particular group, such as young people or criminals

name: moderate
trans: 稳健的，温和的；适度的，中等的；有节制的

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

sentences.english: a pair of sandals
sentences.chinese: 一双凉鞋

detailed_translations.english: a light shoe that is fastened onto your foot by bands of leather or cloth, and is worn in warm weather

name: holder
trans: 持有人；所有人；固定器；（台、架等）支持物

sentences.english: the 800 m world record holder
sentences.chinese: 800米世界纪录保持者

sentences.english: Season-ticket holders are furious at the rise in rail fares.
sentences.chinese: 买季票的人对火车票价上涨极为愤怒。

sentences.english: British passport holders
sentences.chinese: 英国护照持有人

detailed_translations.chinese: 持有人；所有人；固定器；（台、架等）支持物
detailed_translations.english: someone who owns or controls something

sentences.english: an emergency generator
sentences.chinese: 应急发电机

sentences.english: The company has been a very good cash generator.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是台非常出色的赚钱机器。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that produces electricity

sentences.english: a stick of celery
sentences.chinese: 一根芹菜

detailed_translations.english: a vegetable with long pale green stems that you can eat cooked or uncooked

sentences.english: Mrs. Hardie refrained from making any comment.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪太太忍住了没做任何评论。

detailed_translations.english: to not do something that you want to do
part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each  verse

sentences.english: A potato has about 90 calories.
sentences.chinese: 一个马铃薯大约有90卡路里的热量。

sentences.english: a calorie-controlled diet
sentences.chinese: 控制热量的日常饮食

sentences.english: I need to burn off a few calories (= lose some weight by exercising ) .
sentences.chinese: 我要消耗掉一些卡路里。

sentences.english: My wife convinced me to finally start counting calories (= control my weight by being careful about what I eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 我妻子终于说服我开始计算卡路里、控制体重。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: haunt
trans: 常出没于…；萦绕于…；经常去…

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

sentences.english: His family responsibilities had started to become a burden.
sentences.chinese: 家庭责任已开始成为他的负担。

detailed_translations.english: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

name: casual
trans: 随便的；非正式的；临时的；偶然的
便装；临时工人；待命士兵

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

name: uneasy
trans: 不舒服的；心神不安的；不稳定的

sentences.english: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.english: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

name: fit
trans: 安装；使……适应；使……合身；与……相符
健康的；合适的；恰当的；准备好的

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

sentences.english: The local paper featured me standing on a stepladder with a caption, "Wendy climbs the ladder to success."
sentences.chinese: 当地的报纸刊登了一幅我站在活梯上的特写，下面写着：“温迪登上了成功之梯。”

detailed_translations.english: words printed above or below a picture in a book or newspaper or on a television screen to explain what the picture is showing

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

sentences.english: He believed that someone had put a curse on the house.
sentences.chinese: 他相信有人对这房子下了诅咒。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sentence used to ask God or a magical power to do something bad to someone or something

name: drip
trans: 水滴，滴水声；静脉滴注；使人厌烦的人

sentences.english: The tap’s dripping .
sentences.chinese: 水龙头在滴水。

sentences.english: Her boots were muddy and her hair was dripping.
sentences.chinese: 她的靴子沾满了泥，头发在滴水。

sentences.english: Water was dripping through the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 水正透过天花板滴下来。

sentences.english: I put some plastic buckets on the floor to catch the drips.
sentences.chinese: 我把几个塑料桶放在地板上接滴下来的水。

detailed_translations.english: to let liquid fall in drops
one of the drops of liquid that fall from something

name: consistent
trans: 始终如一的，一致的；坚持的

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

sentences.english: a cholera outbreak
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发

detailed_translations.english: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen

name: counsel
trans: 法律顾问；忠告；商议；讨论；决策

sentences.english: He assisted me with good counsel and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

sentences.english: Those who counsel US privately, point out that we are wrong, are true friends.
sentences.chinese: 那些私下忠告我们，指出我们错误的人，才是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Their free guidance and counsel will be the most priceless gift you can receive.
sentences.chinese: 他们的免费指导和忠告，将是你能够收到的最无价的礼物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劝告， 忠告；法律顾问； 辩护人
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer who represents you in court

name: revitalize
trans: 使…复活；使…复兴；使…恢复生气

sentences.english: They hope to revitalize the neighborhood by providing better housing.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望通过提供更好的住房条件使这个社区恢复活力。

sentences.english: a revitalizing massage
sentences.chinese: 让人恢复精神的按摩

detailed_translations.english: to put new strength or power into something

sentences.english: Smith said the crimson anthocyanin protects the delicate mechanisms that allow the tree to extract all the nutrients from its leaves.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯说，深红色的花青素保护着微妙的机制，它让树木从叶子里提取所需要的全部营养物。

sentences.english: So for your next holiday party, go for a LRD (Little Red Dress), and suggest he wear a crimson tie to match.
sentences.chinese: 所以说，下一个节日派对，穿着小红裙去吧，还要建议你的那个他也打上一条深红色领带。

sentences.english: Slashes of crimson peep from the lining of his ochre coat, suggesting, perhaps, that there is life in the old fellow yet.
sentences.chinese: 赭色外套的衬里上，深红条纹隐约可见，这也许暗示着在这位老者身上依旧有着年轻的活力。

detailed_translations.english: deep red in colour
if your face crimsons, it becomes red because you are embarrassed

sentences.english: The governor was impeached for using state funds improperly.
sentences.chinese: 州长因违规使用州政府资金而受到弹劾。

detailed_translations.english: if a government official is impeached, they are formally charged with a serious crime in a special government court

name: academy
trans: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校

sentences.english: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
sentences.chinese: 美国艺术和文学学会

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
detailed_translations.english: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

sentences.english: President Kennedy was an alumnus of Harvard University.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统是哈佛大学的毕业生。

detailed_translations.english: a former student of a school, college etc

name: scratch
trans: 打草稿用的；凑合的；碰巧的

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

sentences.english: In Book One alone there are four primary instances of what we can think of as this primary simile dynamic.
sentences.chinese: 仅第一本里就有四个主要的例证,我们可以看作最初的明喻来源的动力。

sentences.english: Lister said people should follow the 1946 advice of writer George Orwell: "Never use a metaphor, simile, or other figure of speech which you are used to seeing in print.
sentences.chinese: 李斯特说人们最好遵循作家乔治·奥威尔1946年提出的建议：“不要使用那些在各种出版物上频繁出现的暗喻、明喻或其他修辞格。”

sentences.english: The simile is a common device and a useful one, but similes coming in rapid fire, one right on top of another, are more distracting than illuminating.
sentences.chinese: 明喻是常用的修辞术，也很好用，但是像连珠炮式的比喻与其说是富有启发性，不如说是在转移注意力。

detailed_translations.english: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words ‘as’ or ‘like’, for example ‘as white as snow’

sentences.english: kitchen utensils
sentences.chinese: 厨房用具

detailed_translations.english: a thing such as a knife, spoon etc that you use when you are cooking

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

sentences.english: The party is split by ideological differences.
sentences.chinese: 意识形态上的差异造成该政党分裂。

detailed_translations.english: based on strong beliefs or ideas, especially political or economic ideas

name: capable
trans: 能干的，能胜任的；有才华的

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: satisfactory
trans: 满意的；符合要求的；赎罪的

sentences.english: His progress this term has been satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 他这学期的进步令人满意。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for a particular purpose

name: bleak
trans: 阴冷的；荒凉的，无遮蔽的；黯淡的，无希望的；冷酷的；单调的

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

name: series
trans: 系列，连续；[电] 串联；级数；丛书

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

name: scout
trans: 搜索，侦察；侦察员；侦察机

sentences.english: He sent three scouts ahead to take a look at the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他派出三名侦察兵到前面侦察大桥的情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索，侦察；侦察员；侦察机
detailed_translations.english: a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy
to examine a place or area in order to get information about it

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

name: sewer
trans: 为…铺设污水管道；用下水道排除…的污水

sentences.english: ...the city's sewer system.
sentences.chinese: …该城市的下水道系统。

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or passage under the ground that carries away waste material and used water from houses, factories etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…铺设污水管道；用下水道排除…的污水
detailed_translations.english: to provide with sewers
to provide with sewers

sentences.english: inherited wealth
sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

detailed_translations.english: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

name: spotlight
trans: 聚光灯；反光灯；公众注意的中心

sentences.english: The yard was lit by three huge spotlights.
sentences.chinese: 院子里亮着三盏巨大的聚光灯。

detailed_translations.english: a light with a very bright beam which can be directed at someone or something. Spotlights are often used to light a stage when actors or singers are performing
to shine a strong beam of light on something

sentences.english: Jah also comes from a strong biblical reference and derivative of the word Jehovah, yet another word for god, king or almighty being.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华也来自于强烈的圣经参考和单词耶和华的派生词，还有另一个单词为上帝，国王或万能的主。

detailed_translations.english: expressions used to talk about God that emphasize His power

name: chip
trans: [电子] 芯片；筹码；碎片；(食物的) 小片; 薄片

sentences.english: the age of the silicon chip
sentences.chinese: 芯片时代

sentences.english: chip technology
sentences.chinese: 芯片技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 屑片， 碎片； 炸土豆条； 集成电路片， 集成块； 缺口， 瑕疵
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of  silicon  that has a set of complicated electrical connections on it and is used to store and  process  information in computers

sentences.english: She was swindled out of ￡ 1,000 by a witch.
sentences.chinese: 她被一个女巫骗了一千英镑。

sentences.english: The old witch said she could raise the dead.
sentences.chinese: 老巫婆说她能起死回生。

sentences.english: A witch was supposed to take the shape of a cat.
sentences.chinese: 据说女巫会化为猫的形状。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is supposed to have magic powers, especially to do bad things

sentences.english: He was up all night with tummy ache .
sentences.chinese: 他肚子疼，整晚都睡不着觉。

detailed_translations.english: stomach  – used especially by or to children

sentences.english: Lifeguard driving a sampan came to church with the priest said: "Father, come as soon as possible on!
sentences.chinese: 一个救生员驾着舢板来到教堂，跟神父说：“神父，赶快上来吧！

sentences.english: I saw a thirty-foot sampan [boat] that had been lifted neatly on top of the roof of a prostrated house.
sentences.chinese: 我看到一个30英尺长的小船被冲到了坍塌了的房顶上。

detailed_translations.english: a small boat used in China and Southeast Asia

sentences.english: You’d better go and see the quack with that burn.
sentences.chinese: 你最好去找医生看看那处烧伤。

sentences.english: There were ducks quacking on the lawn.
sentences.chinese: 有鸭子在草坪上发出嘎嘎的叫着。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor
When a duck quacks, it makes the noise that ducks typically make
relating to the activities or medicines of someone who pretends to be a doctor

sentences.english: the removal of rubbish
sentences.chinese: 移除垃圾

sentences.english: stain removal
sentences.chinese: 去污

detailed_translations.english: when something is taken away from, out of, or off the place where it is

name: glow
trans: 灼热；色彩鲜艳；兴高采烈

sentences.english: The bedside lamp glowed dimly.
sentences.chinese: 床头灯发出暗淡的光。

sentences.english: The fireplace was still glowing with the remains of last night’s fire.
sentences.chinese: 壁炉中，隔夜的余烬依然在微微发光。

sentences.english: The red tip of his cigarette was glowing in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 他那红红的烟头在黑暗中幽幽发光。

sentences.english: The moisturizer gave my face a healthy glow that lasted all day.
sentences.chinese: 这种润肤霜给我脸上带来了持续整天的一种健康的红光。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or  reflect  a soft steady light
A glow is a pink colour on a person's face, usually because they are healthy or have been exercising

name: vine
trans: 藤；葡萄树；藤本植物；攀缘植物

sentences.english: Every square metre of soil was used, mainly for olives, vines, and almonds.
sentences.chinese: 每一平方米的土壤都用上了，主要是种植橄榄、葡萄藤和杏树。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藤；葡萄树；藤本植物；攀缘植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that produces grapes

name: mole
trans: 鼹鼠；痣；防波堤；胎块；间谍

sentences.english: Researchers studied moles on those aged between 12 and 50.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们研究了12岁到50岁的人身上长的痣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼹鼠；痣；防波堤；胎块；间谍
detailed_translations.english: a small dark furry animal which is almost blind. Moles usually live under the ground.

sentences.english: She's feeling a little homesick.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有些想家了。

detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because you are a long way from your home

name: honorary
trans: 荣誉的；名誉的；道义上的
名誉学位；获名誉学位者；名誉团体

sentences.english: Brown received an honorary doctorate from Seoul University.
sentences.chinese: 布朗获得了首尔大学的荣誉博士学位。

detailed_translations.english: an honorary title, rank, or university degree is given to someone as an honour

sentences.english: The steel pillars began to buckle.
sentences.chinese: 这些钢柱开始变形了。

detailed_translations.english: to become bent or curved because of heat or pressure, or to make something bend or curve in this way
a piece of metal used for fastening the two ends of a belt, for fastening a shoe, bag etc, or for decoration

sentences.english: The building does not conform with safety regulations.
sentences.chinese: 例句：这座建筑物不符合安全条例。

sentences.english: It did not conform to the usual stereotype of an industrial city.
sentences.chinese: 这和一座常规的工业城市那种千篇一律的格局不一样。

detailed_translations.english: to obey a law, rule etc

name: reciprocal
trans: 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的
[数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物

sentences.english: He spoke of the necessity for a reciprocal relationship that would be useful for all sides.
sentences.chinese: 他谈及需要建立对各方都有益的互惠关系。

sentences.english: Such treaties provide reciprocal rights and obligations.
sentences.chinese: 此类协议规定了相互之间的权利与义务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的
detailed_translations.english: a reciprocal arrangement or relationship is one in which two people or groups do or give the same things to each other

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物

sentences.english: The key to success is the combination of transformation optics with another promising new field of science known as plasmonics.
sentences.chinese: 成功的关键是转变的光学与另一个有希望的表面电浆子场组合，被称为新的科学。

sentences.english: But it was, ironically, not until the invention of the laser in 1960 that understanding the quantum nature of optics became crucial.
sentences.chinese: 但是，具有讽刺意义的是，直到1960年激光发明后，认识光学的量子本质才变得至关重要。

sentences.english: One essential tool is adaptive optics technology, which, in effect, takes the twinkle out of the stars, thus providing sharper images from telescopes on the ground than would otherwise be possible.
sentences.chinese: 一个重要的工具就是自适应光学技术，实际上就是通过地面上的望远镜将恒星的闪耀去除，从而比采用其他方法能提供更为明显的图像。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of light and the way we see

sentences.english: ...her 20 years of service with the township and county.
sentences.chinese: ...她为镇区和郡服务的20年。

detailed_translations.english: a town in Canada or the US that has some local government

name: sphere
trans: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

detailed_translations.english: a ball shape

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

sentences.english: They eyeballed each other suspiciously.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑地互相打量。

detailed_translations.english: the round ball that forms the whole of your eye, including the part inside your head
to look directly and closely at something or someone

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

name: enormous
trans: 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

sentences.english: A fresh cascade of splintered glass tinkled to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 大量刚裂开的玻璃碎片落到地板上，发出清脆的响声。

sentences.english: We strolled past tinkling fountains and perfumed gardens.
sentences.chinese: 我们漫步走过发出清脆声音的喷泉和香气四溢的花园。

detailed_translations.english: If something tinkles, it makes a clear, high-pitched, ringing noise, especially as small parts of it strike a surface
a light ringing sound

sentences.english: coffee and walnut cake
sentences.chinese: 咖啡核桃蛋糕

detailed_translations.english: a nut that you can eat, shaped like a human brain

name: array
trans: 数组，阵列；排列，列阵；大批，一系列；衣服

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: rash
trans: 轻率的；鲁莽的；不顾后果的
[皮肤] 皮疹；突然大量出现的事物

sentences.english: Please Jessie, don’t do anything rash.
sentences.chinese: 求你了，杰西，不要草率行事。

sentences.english: Don’t go making any rash decisions about your future!
sentences.chinese: 不要对你的未来贸然作决定！

sentences.english: It was rather rash of you to lend them your car.
sentences.chinese: 你把汽车借给他们实在有欠考虑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；鲁莽的；不顾后果的
detailed_translations.english: if you are rash, you do things too quickly, without thinking carefully about whether they are sensible or not

detailed_translations.chinese: [皮肤] 皮疹；突然大量出现的事物
detailed_translations.english: a lot of red spots on someone’s skin, caused by an illness

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was taught by the Catholic nuns whose school he attended to work and study hard.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生受教于天主教修女。在修女开办的学校里他专心工作，刻苦学习。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is a member of a group of religious women that live together in a convent

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

name: payable
trans: 应付的；到期的；可付的；可获利的

sentences.english: The rent is payable in advance .
sentences.chinese: 租金须预付。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应付的；到期的；可付的；可获利的
detailed_translations.english: a bill, debt etc that is payable must be paid

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

sentences.english: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

detailed_translations.english: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

name: dominate
trans: 控制；支配；占优势；在…中占主要地位

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: loaded
trans: 负荷的；装填子弹的；装好胶卷的；喝醉了的（美国俚语）；阔绰的（美国俚语）

sentences.english: a loaded pistol
sentences.chinese: 子弹上膛的手枪

detailed_translations.chinese: 负荷的；装填子弹的；装好胶卷的；喝醉了的（美国俚语）；阔绰的（美国俚语）
detailed_translations.english: containing bullets, film etc

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

sentences.english: I sing with the university chorus.
sentences.chinese: 我在大学合唱队里唱歌。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people who sing together
if people chorus something, they say it at the same time

name: assert
trans: 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: fluent
trans: 流畅的，流利的；液态的；畅流的

sentences.english: She was fluent in English, French, and German.
sentences.chinese: 她的英语、法语和德语都很流利。

detailed_translations.english: able to speak a language very well

name: only
trans: 唯一的，仅有的；最合适的

sentences.english: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
sentences.chinese: 娜奥米结婚时才17岁。

sentences.english: There are only a few cars on the island.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上只有几辆汽车。

sentences.english: It’s only eight o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 才8点钟。

sentences.english: I was the only woman there.
sentences.chinese: 我是那里唯一的女性。

detailed_translations.english: not more than a particular number, age etc
used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others

name: oppress
trans: 压迫，压抑；使……烦恼；使……感到沉重

sentences.english: native tribes oppressed by the authorities
sentences.chinese: 受到当局压迫的土著部落

detailed_translations.chinese: 压迫， 压制； 使沉重， 使烦恼
detailed_translations.english: to treat a group of people unfairly or cruelly, and prevent them from having the same rights that other people in society have

sentences.english: his intent gaze
sentences.chinese: 他专注的凝视

detailed_translations.chinese: 专心的， 专注的； 急切的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else
what you intend to do

sentences.english: Their motorboat struck a rock and began to sink.
sentences.chinese: 他们的摩托艇触了礁，开始下沉。

sentences.english: The kids watched as the coin sank to the bottom of the pool.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们看着那枚硬币沉到池底。

sentences.english: The heavy guns sank up to their barrels in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 这些沉重的大炮深陷在泥里，只露出炮管。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下沉，沉没；降低，下落；陷入；衰退，恶化
detailed_translations.english: to go down below the surface of water, mud etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 使下沉，使沉没；降低；掘，挖，凿
detailed_translations.english: to go down below the surface of water, mud etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 水槽， 水池， 洗涤槽
detailed_translations.english: a large open container that you fill with water and use for washing yourself, washing dishes etc

sentences.english: He wants to learn Esperanto.
sentences.chinese: 他要学世界语。

sentences.english: He teaches Esperanto at that university.
sentences.chinese: 他在那所大学教世界语。

sentences.english: English is no Esperanto, but as world languages go, it is considerably user-friendly.
sentences.chinese: 英语非为世界语，但与各种世界语言相比，其相当容易掌握。

detailed_translations.english: an artificial language invented in 1887 to help people from different countries in the world speak to each other

sentences.english: The course syllabus consisted mainly of novels by African-American authors, male and female.
sentences.chinese: 该课程的教学大纲主要包括了非裔美国男女作家的小说。

detailed_translations.english: a plan that states exactly what students at a school or college should learn in a particular subject

sentences.english: a crucifix above the high altar
sentences.chinese: 主圣坛上方的耶稣受难像

sentences.english: The victim was tied to a sacrificial altar.
sentences.chinese: 牺牲被绑在祭坛上。

detailed_translations.english: a holy table or surface used in religious ceremonies

name: intercept
trans: 拦截；[数] 截距；截获的情报

sentences.english: an attempt to intercept drugs being smuggled over the border
sentences.chinese: 阻截毒品走私入境的努力

sentences.english: His phone calls were intercepted.
sentences.chinese: 他的电话被截听了。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something or someone that is going from one place to another before they get there

detailed_translations.chinese: 拦截；[数] 截距；截获的情报

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

sentences.english: the solitude of her house on the lake
sentences.chinese: 她湖边那所房子的清静

detailed_translations.english: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

name: laptop
trans: 膝上型轻便电脑，笔记本电脑

sentences.english: She used to work at her laptop until four in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 她以前经常在笔记本电脑前工作到凌晨4点钟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 膝上型轻便电脑，笔记本电脑
detailed_translations.english: a small computer that you can carry with you

name: fiery
trans: 热烈的，炽烈的；暴躁的；燃烧般的

sentences.english: He has a fiery temper .
sentences.chinese: 他脾气火爆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热烈的，炽烈的；暴躁的；燃烧般的
detailed_translations.english: becoming angry or excited very quickly

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: maternity
trans: 母性，母道；[妇产] 妇产科医院

sentences.english: a maternity dress
sentences.chinese: 孕妇装

detailed_translations.chinese: 母性，母道；[妇产] 妇产科医院
detailed_translations.english: the state of being a mother
relating to a woman who is  pregnant  or who has just had a baby

name: surge
trans: 汹涌；大浪，波涛；汹涌澎湃；巨涌

sentences.english: a device that protects your computer against electrical surges
sentences.chinese: 一台计算机电涌保护设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 汹涌；大浪，波涛；汹涌澎湃；巨涌
detailed_translations.english: a sudden quick movement of a liquid, electricity, chemical etc through something
if a feeling surges or surges up, you begin to feel it very strongly

sentences.english: watching the racing on television
sentences.chinese: 在电视上看赛马

sentences.english: today’s racing results
sentences.chinese: 今天的赛马结果

detailed_translations.english: the sport of racing horses
designed or bred to go very fast and be used for racing

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

sentences.english: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。

sentences.english: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动，反对在该地区倾倒核废物。

sentences.english: a vigorous debate
sentences.chinese: 一场激烈的辩论

sentences.english: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。

sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

sentences.english: The eagerness and belief that filled me then and exacted a pledge from life that life could never fulfill?
sentences.chinese: 那时我的身心充满了渴望和信念，向生活索求一种生活绝不会满足的保证吗？

sentences.english: Sometimes I see the same eagerness and belief in the faces of children and teenagers and the sight brings back the same sadness I feel in remembering myself.
sentences.chinese: 有时我在儿童和十几岁的孩子们的脸上见到过这种相同的渴望和信念，在想到我自己时，感觉这情形使我回想起同样的悲哀。

sentences.english: Expectancy - Come before God with anticipation and eagerness.
sentences.chinese: 盼望 -  来到神面前要有期待和渴望。

name: unkind
trans: 无情的；不仁慈的，不厚道的

sentences.english: A lot of unkind things were said.
sentences.chinese: 说了很多刻薄话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；不仁慈的，不厚道的
detailed_translations.english: nasty, unpleasant, or cruel

sentences.english: ‘Anyone else would have done the same thing,’ he said with typical modesty.
sentences.chinese: 换了谁都会这么做的。”他带着一贯的谦虚说道。

sentences.english: There were shrieks of embarrassment as the girls struggled to protect their modesty.
sentences.chinese: 竭力保持着端庄形象的女孩们发出了尴尬的尖叫。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of not talking much about your abilities or possessions

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

sentences.english: He is well grounded in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 他拉丁语的功底很扎实。

sentences.english: I must brush up on my Latin.
sentences.chinese: 我必须把拉丁语重温一下。

sentences.english: This word comes from Latin.
sentences.chinese: 这个词源于拉丁语。

detailed_translations.english: the language used in ancient Rome

name: tub
trans: 洗盆浴；（衣服等）被放在桶里洗

sentences.english: I had a long soak in the tub.
sentences.chinese: 我在浴缸里泡了很久。

detailed_translations.english: a large container in which you sit to wash yourself

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗盆浴；（衣服等）被放在桶里洗

sentences.english: India has a good scientific research base.
sentences.chinese: 印度有良好的科研基础。

detailed_translations.english: the most important part of something, from which new ideas develop
not having good moral principles
to have your main place of work, business etc in a particular place

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

sentences.english: Police are investigating a series of bank robberies in South Wales.

detailed_translations.english: the crime of stealing money or things from a bank, shop etc, especially using violence

sentences.chinese: 用了这种发胶，即使最干枯的头发也会增添光泽。

name: lawful
trans: 合法的；法定的；法律许可的

sentences.chinese: 这些课程的编排是有连续性的。

name: tactical
trans: 战术的；策略的；善于策略的

sentences.chinese: 两名球员因战术需要被替换下场。

sentences.chinese: 我们的船靠向码头。

sentences.chinese: 船夫用竿把船推离码头。

sentences.chinese: 那艘船停靠在码头边。

detailed_translations.english: a structure that is built out into the water so that boats can stop next to it

sentences.chinese: 我们分担家务。

sentences.chinese: 完全无毒蛇大家庭中的一种，王蛇，也进化出了能中和响尾蛇毒液的血清，并且靠着这一能力获得了比松鼠们更大的好处。

sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.chinese: 你的按揭贷款将在25年内还清。

sentences.chinese: 一双厚实耐穿的鞋子

sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛

sentences.chinese: 大多数的电脑使用者都没有经过正规的键盘操作训练，因此他们的键盘技巧不够熟练。

sentences.chinese: 这些分子被吸收到血液里，从而影响到器官。

sentences.chinese: 卡彭特取保获释，同时对判决提出上诉。

sentences.chinese: 他不大可能获保释。

sentences.chinese: 卡特已经被拒绝保释，继续拘押。

sentences.chinese: 法官下令琼斯不得保释。

sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: harsh
trans: 严厉的；严酷的；刺耳的；粗糙的；刺目的

sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

trans: 可能性；可能发生的事物

sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation

name: odd
trans: 奇数的；古怪的；剩余的；临时的；零散的

sentences.english: It was an odd thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.english: an odd way to behave
sentences.chinese: 古怪的行为

sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.english: There was something odd about him.
sentences.chinese: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.english: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

sentences.chinese: 我们拒绝和恐怖分子对话。

sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子引爆造成168人死亡的炸弹

sentences.chinese: 海鲜餐馆

detailed_translations.english: animals from the sea that you can eat, for example fish and  shellfish

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

name: saw
trans: 看见；明白，了解；锯；锯成；锯开

sentences.chinese: 屋子里仅有的工具是一把锤子和一把锯。

sentences.chinese: 她在后院锯木头。

detailed_translations.english: a tool that you use for cutting wood. It has a flat blade with an edge cut into many V shapes.

sentences.english: They do not keep a tally of visitors to the palace, but it is very popular.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有对来宫殿的游客作一个记录，不过这个地方非常受欢迎的。

detailed_translations.english: A tally is a record of amounts or numbers which you keep changing and adding to as the activity which affects it progresses
if numbers or statements tally, they match exactly

name: sorghum
trans: 高粱；[作物] 蜀黍；甜得发腻的东西

sentences.english: But some plants, including maize and sorghum, have evolved to use a type called C4.
sentences.chinese: 但是一些植物，包括玉米和高粱，进化成了使用C4型的光合作用。
